definition[0]: to deliberately pay no attention to something that you have been told or that you know about
example[0]: You can’t ignore the fact that many criminals never go to prison.
example[1]: problems which we can’t afford to ignore
definition[1]: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something
example[2]: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
example[4]: He had completely ignored her remark, preferring his own theory.
explanation[0]: In everyday British English, people often say take no notice of something or not take any notice of something rather than ignore something:
example[5]: There are signs telling you not to smoke, but people don’t take any notice of them.
